questionList.choiceC: Non-literate societies so that they got modern education

questionList.choiceA: It was able to force Italy to renounce its claims to a protectorate over Ethiopia.
questionList.choiceB: All European countries openly opposed it.
questionList.choiceC: All European countries openly supported it.

questionList.choiceA: A program to achieve the liberation of Africa from global economic structures
questionList.choiceB: A program by Western financial institutions to influence economic planning and management in Africa

questionList.choiceD: A Pan-African program to restructure economic relationships among African countries

questionList.choiceA: Represented a successful attack on a symbol of the tyranny of the Old Regime.
questionList.choiceB: Placed the royal family under the power of the revolutionaries,
questionList.choiceC: Gave the revolutionaries a strong Wise.
questionList.choiceD: Released thousands of prisoners who joined the revolutionary army

questionList.choiceA: The declaration of Amharic as the only official language
questionList.choiceB: The persecution of the descendants of the last Zagwe rule
questionList.choiceC: An immediate start of hostilities with the Muslim states to the south.
questionList.choiceD: The claim that Yekuno Amlak was 'restoring' the 'Solomonic Dynasty' to the throne.

questionList.choiceA: Liberia
questionList.choiceB: Botswana.
questionList.choiceC: Guinea-Bissau

questionList.choiceA: Was revolutionary while the latter was conservative
questionList.choiceB: Was crushed with outside military assistance while the latter was suppressed with no such assistance

questionList.choiceB: Menelik's attempt to evict them from Eritrea
questionList.choiceC: Their unprepared ness to cha1lege Ethiopia

questionList.choiceB: The colonists enjoyed the support of European enemies of Britain.
questionList.choiceC: Black Americans played no role at all.

questionList.questionStatement: How do you understand the common statement that history repeats itself?
questionList.choiceA: What happened in the past sometimes happens again.
questionList.choiceB: People tend to repeat the same mistakes that their ancestors committed.
questionList.choiceC: Events sometimes near very close resemblance to those that have occurred before
questionList.choiceD: It is God who has control over what happens, not humans.

questionList.choiceB: Had its own monarchs who adopted the title of Tato, equivalent to king.
questionList.choiceC: Was a rich and powerful state which survived until the last decade of the 19th century.
questionList.choiceD: Was a weak state and was frequently ruled by its neighboring states.

questionList.choiceA: Military superiority of the Europeans
questionList.choiceB: Lack of unity among Africans
questionList.choiceC: The convenience of the African terrain for Europeans armies
questionList.choiceD: The under population of Africa

questionList.choiceA: It helps societies to learn about their past in order to understand about the present and about themselves.
questionList.choiceB: It only tells about the political activities of rulers.
questionList.choiceC: It is an interesting and relaxing story
questionList.choiceD: It is a narration of events which attracts the attention of people.

questionList.choiceB: Contact with the outside world was non-existent.

questionList.choiceB: Traditional hostility between Britain and France

questionList.choiceC: It issued family laws that permitted polygamy

questionList.choiceB: They are neither more nor less reliable than written sources.
questionList.choiceC: They are necessarily less reliable than written sources.
questionList.choiceD: They become more reliable if the informants are advanced in age.

questionList.questionStatement: What does it mean that World War I was 'a total war'?
questionList.choiceA: The countries involved mobilized all their adult, fit populations and economic resources to achieve victory.
questionList.choiceB: There was no country in the world that did not participate in one way or another.
questionList.choiceC: No country was prepared to accept a settlement short of total victory
questionList.choiceD: The war was conducted on land, sea and air.

questionList.choiceC: Focused on the morality of human action while the latte focused on life after death.

questionList.choiceC: They were only ancestors of the African societies and belonged to the black race.

questionList.choiceC: All the major movements brought in people from outside of the current borders of Ethiopia.

questionList.choiceC: It ended effectively in 1960
